The diagnosis of brain death is based on :

*clinical criteria:
**Total absence of consciousness and spontaneous motor activity;
**Abolition of all brainstem reflexes;
**Total absence of spontaneous ventilation verified by a hypercapnia test.
*and paraclinical criteria:
**2 null and reactive electroencephalograms for 30 minutes performed 4 hours apart;
**or cerebral angiography showing cessation of encephalic circulation.

question.title: What is the primary clinical criterion for diagnosing brain death?
question.description: The diagnostic criteria for brain death

option_a.title: Total absence of consciousness and spontaneous motor activity
option_a.description: One of the clinical criteria for brain death

option_b.title: Total absence of spontaneous ventilation verified by a hypercapnia test
option_b.description: An alternative clinical criterion for brain death

option_c.title: Total absence of brainstem reflexes and cerebral angiography showing cessation of encephalic circulation
option_c.description: A combination of clinical and paraclinical criteria for brain death

option_d.title: Total absence of consciousness, spontaneous motor activity, and absence of brainstem reflexes
option_d.description: A criterion that includes all aspects of brain death diagnosis

correct_option.title: Total absence of consciousness and spontaneous motor activity
